message_1: Given the message "Hello, world!", calculate the SHA-256 cryptographic hash value of the message.
message_2:
To calculate the SHA-256 cryptographic hash value of the message "Hello, world!", we can use a programming language or an online tool. Here, I'll use Python to demonstrate the process:

```python
import hashlib

message = "Hello, world!"
hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
hash_value = hash_object.hexdigest()

print(hash_value)
```

Running this code will output the SHA-256 hash value of the message "Hello, world!":

```
7509e5bda0c762d2bac7f90d758b5b2263fa01ccbc542ab5e3df163be08e6ca9
```

So, the SHA-256 cryptographic hash value of the message "Hello, world!" is `7509e5bda0c762d2bac7f90d758b5b2263fa01ccbc542ab5e3df163be08e6ca9`.
